protocol_name: BIOL 354W - Research Methods in Advance Microbiology
protocol_name_html: BIOL 354W - Research Methods in Advance Microbiology
description: This protocol series will guide students through the experience of analyzing metagenomic data.
status_info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

components.data: Introduction to BIOL 354W, sequencing data and bioinformatics
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Introduction to BIOL 354W, sequencing data and bioinformatics

components.data:
In order to do bioinformatics, we first need to become comfortable using the computational language and basic skills that will allow you to analyze data. 

 

Open this link in Chrome

components.data:
he first step in analyzing the sequencing data set is to asses the quality of the sequence, and then to edit the dataset in order to retain only the highest quality sequences for the following analysis.

 

To this end we will use: FastQC - A high throughput sequence QC analysis tool 

 

Familiarize your self with the software by looking at their web page - check out the video tutorial!
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
he first step in analyzing the sequencing data set is to asses the quality of the sequence, and then to edit the dataset in order to retain only the highest quality sequences for the following analysis.

 

To this end we will use: FastQC - A high throughput sequence QC analysis tool 

 

Familiarize your self with the software by looking at their web page - check out the video tutorial!

source_data.name: alias fastqc=/opt/BioInfo_tools/FastQC/fastqc
source_data.description: Create an alias for the command "fastqc" by providing it the path to the fastqc command. Using alias tells the computer that when you type fastqc , you expect the computer to look in /opt/BioInfo_tools/FastQC/fastqc

source_data.name: fastqc seqfile1.fastq
source_data.description: Now that the computer knows where to find the software, you can use a the "fastqc" command to assess the quality of your sequence. First you would write the command "fastqc" followed by the sequence that you want to analyze "seqfile1.fastq"

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 3 of BIOL 354W - Research Methods in Advance Microbiology
source_data.protocol_name: BIOL 354W - Research Methods in Advance Microbiology
source_data.protocol_name_html: BIOL 354W - Research Methods in Advance Microbiology
source_data.annotation: You can perform the fastqc file on .fastq files and also in .fastq.gz files or compressed files
source_data.thread_text: You can perform the fastqc file on .fastq files and also in .fastq.gz files or compressed files
source_data.body: You can perform the fastqc file on .fastq files and also in .fastq.gz files or compressed files

source_data.name: scp -r username@bio-server-2.willamette.edu:/home/username/folder_with_fastqc_file ~/Desktop/
source_data.description: Now that the software has run and you have folders and files with date, you should look at the data to assess the quality and make decision about the quality control step that we will work on next. For this you can unzip you folder where there will be detail information about the results, as well as a summary of the run. You can also download the .html file to look at the graphic representation of the run, the same format you experienced on the fasqc web and tutorial

components.data:
To assemble our metagenomes we will try two differnet assemblies and compare them. First we will try IDBA_UD and Megahit assemblies. 

 

Megahit github - https://github.com/voutcn/megahit/

Megahit article - https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/31/10/1674/177884

 

IDBA_UD - https://github.com/loneknightpy/idba

IDBA_UD article - https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/28/11/1420/266973
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
To assemble our metagenomes we will try two differnet assemblies and compare them. First we will try IDBA_UD and Megahit assemblies. 

 

Megahit github - https://github.com/voutcn/megahit/

Megahit article - https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/31/10/1674/177884

 

IDBA_UD - https://github.com/loneknightpy/idba

IDBA_UD article - https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/28/11/1420/266973

source_data.name: /opt/BioInfo_tools/idba/bin/fq2fa read.fq read.fa
source_data.description: IDBA series assemblers accept FASTA format reads. FASTQ format reads can be converted by fq2fa program in the package. This is the command to convert one fastq file at a time

source_data.name: /opt/BioInfo_tools/idba/bin/fq2fa --merge --filter read_R1.fq read_R2.fq read.fa
source_data.description: IDBA-UD requires paired-end reads stored in the same FASTA file. A pair of reads should be in two consecutive lines. If not, please use fq2fa to merge two FASTQ read files to single file

source_data.name: /opt/BioInfo_tools/idba/idba_ud -r merged_reads.fa -o output_dir
source_data.description: Once the read files are converted into fasta and in consecutive order then the assembly can be run

components.data: Assessing the quality of the assemblies
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Assessing the quality of the assemblies

components.data:
We can investigate assembly statistics to compare which assembly is best between the two assemblies utilized. For this we can use a software called Quast.

 

Metrics based only on contigs:

  • Number of large contigs (i.e., longer than 500 bp) and total length of them.
  • Length of the largest contig.
  • N50 (length of a contig, such that all the contigs of at least the same length together cover at least 50% of the assembly).
  • Number of predicted genes, discovered either by GeneMark.hmm (for prokaryotes), GeneMark-ES or GlimmerHMM (for eukaryotes), or MetaGeneMark (for metagenomes).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
We can investigate assembly statistics to compare which assembly is best between the two assemblies utilized. For this we can use a software called Quast.

 

Metrics based only on contigs:

  • Number of large contigs (i.e., longer than 500 bp) and total length of them.
  • Length of the largest contig.
  • N50 (length of a contig, such that all the contigs of at least the same length together cover at least 50% of the assembly).
  • Number of predicted genes, discovered either by GeneMark.hmm (for prokaryotes), GeneMark-ES or GlimmerHMM (for eukaryotes), or MetaGeneMark (for metagenomes).

source_data.name: /opt/BioInfo_tools/quast/metaquast.py contig.fa --gene-finding
source_data.description: QUAST evaluates genome assemblies by computing various metrics.

components.data:
MaxBin is a software for binning assembled metagenomic sequences based on an Expectation-Maximization algorithm.

 

Users provide the assembled metagenomic sequences and the reads coverage information or sequencing reads. MaxBin will report genome-related statistics, including estimated completeness, GC content and genome size in the binning summary page.

 

MaxBin article - https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/32/4/605/1744462
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
MaxBin is a software for binning assembled metagenomic sequences based on an Expectation-Maximization algorithm.

 

Users provide the assembled metagenomic sequences and the reads coverage information or sequencing reads. MaxBin will report genome-related statistics, including estimated completeness, GC content and genome size in the binning summary page.

 

MaxBin article - https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/32/4/605/1744462

source_data.name: perl /opt/BioInfo_tools/MaxBin-2.2.4/run_MaxBin.pl -contig "assembled.fa" -reads "concatenated reads fasta" -out "out directory"
source_data.description: MaxBin requires the assembled contains file and also the file that contains the sequence reads

components.data: Assuring DNA sequencing quality using Trimmomatic
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Assuring DNA sequencing quality using Trimmomatic

components.data:
Trimmomatic: A flexible read trimming tool for Illumina NGS data (Website - http://www.usadellab.org/cms/?page=trimmomatic)

 

Description

Trimmomatic performs a variety of useful trimming tasks for illumina paired-end and single ended data.The selection of trimming steps and their associated parameters are supplied on the command line.

The current trimming steps are:

  • ILLUMINACLIP: Cut adapter and other illumina-specific sequences from the read.
  • SLIDINGWINDOW: Perform a sliding window trimming, cutting once the average quality within the window falls below a threshold.
  • LEADING: Cut bases off the start of a read, if below a threshold quality
  • TRAILING: Cut bases off the end of a read, if below a threshold quality
  • CROP: Cut the read to a specified length
  • HEADCROP: Cut the specified number of bases from the start of the read
  • MINLEN: Drop the read if it is below a specified length
  • TOPHRED33: Convert quality scores to Phred-33
  • TOPHRED64: Convert quality scores to Phred-64
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Trimmomatic: A flexible read trimming tool for Illumina NGS data (Website - http://www.usadellab.org/cms/?page=trimmomatic)

 

Description

Trimmomatic performs a variety of useful trimming tasks for illumina paired-end and single ended data.The selection of trimming steps and their associated parameters are supplied on the command line.

The current trimming steps are:

  • ILLUMINACLIP: Cut adapter and other illumina-specific sequences from the read.
  • SLIDINGWINDOW: Perform a sliding window trimming, cutting once the average quality within the window falls below a threshold.
  • LEADING: Cut bases off the start of a read, if below a threshold quality
  • TRAILING: Cut bases off the end of a read, if below a threshold quality
  • CROP: Cut the read to a specified length
  • HEADCROP: Cut the specified number of bases from the start of the read
  • MINLEN: Drop the read if it is below a specified length
  • TOPHRED33: Convert quality scores to Phred-33
  • TOPHRED64: Convert quality scores to Phred-64

source_data.name: java -jar /opt/BioInfo_tools/Trimmomatic-0.36/trimmomatic-0.36.jar PE -phred33 input_forward.fq.gz input_reverse.fq.gz output_forward_paired.fq.gz output_forward_unpaired.fq.gz output_reverse_paired.fq.gz output_reverse_unpaired.fq.gz ILLUMINACLIP:TruSeq3-PE.fa:2:30:10 LEADING:3 TRAILING:3 SLIDINGWINDOW:4:15 MINLEN:36
source_data.description: Try to run this command as is with a Q15 and then with Q30. Record the number % of out put sequences per each.
